intro: Eriococcus ovalifolia, commonly known as the woollyleaf eriococcus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Brazil, and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils and thrives in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Its leaves are oval-shaped and covered in a soft, white pubescence, giving it a distinctive appearance. Eriococcus ovalifolia produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or white, adding ornamental value to its natural habitat.
